XMLDB.COMMENT: XMLDB file for Totara featured links block

TABLE.NAME: block_totara_featured_links_tiles
TABLE.COMMENT: Defines tiles for Totara featured links blocks

FIELD.NAME: blockid
FIELD.COMMENT: This is the block id that the tile belongs to

FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.COMMENT: This is the type of tile. Basically a namespace to a class that extends base

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: The order which the tile will be displayed in the block uses blockid-sortorder

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The tile that the tile was created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time that the tile was modified

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user that created the tile or is the owner of the tile

FIELD.NAME: dataraw
FIELD.COMMENT: The raw Json encoded data about how to display the tile

FIELD.NAME: visibility
FIELD.COMMENT: What the base visibility option is

FIELD.NAME: audienceaggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: The aggregation of the audience rules ie AND or OR

FIELD.NAME: presetsraw
FIELD.COMMENT: The comma separated strings that refer to the preset rules that apply to the tile

FIELD.NAME: presetsaggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: The aggregation of the preset rules ie the logic to combine them

FIELD.NAME: overallaggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: The aggregation for the section ie matches audience and preset

FIELD.NAME: tilerules
FIELD.COMMENT: This is where the data for the tile specific rules go in. Can be pretty much anything you want.

FIELD.NAME: audienceshowing
FIELD.COMMENT: This field holds whether the audience rules are to be applied

FIELD.NAME: presetshowing
FIELD.COMMENT: This field holds whether the preset rules are to be applied

FIELD.NAME: tilerulesshowing
FIELD.COMMENT: This field holds whether the tile defined rules are to be applied

FIELD.NAME: parentid
FIELD.COMMENT: The tile that is the parent of this tile

KEY.NAME: blockid
KEY.COMMENT: Id for the block that the tile is in

KEY.NAME: userid
KEY.COMMENT: The user who created the tile

KEY.NAME: parentid
KEY.COMMENT: The id of the parent tiles
